definition: the Moon (esp. in Daoism)
highest/greatest/too (much)/very/extremely
variant of 陰|阴[yin1]
surname Yin
overcast (weather)/cloudy/shady/Yin (the negative principle of Yin and Yang)/negative (electric.)/feminine/moon/implicit/hidden/genitalia

sentences.english: The second section summarizes the physiology function of the Spleen Meridian of Foot-Taiyin.
sentences.chinese: 第二节总结了足太阴脾经生理功能。

sentences.english: After the storm the sun broke through the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 风暴过后太阴冲破了云层。

sentences.english: It was over twice the distance of the earth from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 那是地球到太阴的距离的两倍多。

sentences.english: It is no use talking to him about it.
sentences.chinese: 和他谈这事没用，应用归手足太阴经及足厥阴经。

sentences.english: Objective To study the law of syndrome elements differentiation of Taiyin disease in TCM.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨太阴病证的中医辨证规律。

sentences.english: All traditional Chinese festivals are lunar calendar festivals.
sentences.chinese: 中国的传统节日都是按照太阴历计算的。

definition: five phases of Chinese philosophy: wood 木, fire 火, earth 土, metal 金, water 水
fiend/demon/very/(Tw) SARS (loanword)
to terminate/to cut short/to bring to a stop/to squeeze/to tighten/to damage/variant of 殺|杀[sha1]
yin and yang

four divisions (of the twenty-eight constellations 二十八宿[er4 shi2 ba1 xiu4] of the sky into groups of seven mansions), namely: Azure Dragon 青龍|青龙[Qing1 long2], White Tiger 白虎[Bai2 hu3], Vermilion Bird 朱雀[Zhu1 que4], Black Tortoise 玄武[Xuan2 wu3]
the seven planets of premodern astronomy (the Sun, the Moon, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn)
to bewilder/to dazzle and confuse/the planet Mars
five chief demons of folklore personifying pestilence/also written 五瘟神
see 青龍|青龙[Qing1 long2]
old variant of 邪[xie2]
demonic/iniquitous/nefarious/evil/unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)/(coll.) strange/abnormal

seven emotional states/seven affects of traditional Chinese medical theory and therapy, namely: joy 喜[xi3], anger 怒[nu4], anxiety 憂|忧[you1], thought 思[si1], grief 悲[bei1], fear 恐[kong3], fright 驚|惊[jing1]/seven relations

the twelve equatorial constellations or signs of the zodiac in Western astronomy and astrology, namely: Aries 白羊[Bai2 yang2], Taurus 金牛[Jin4 niu2], Gemini 雙子|双子[Shuang1 zi3], Cancer 巨蟹[Ju4 xie4], Leo 獅子|狮子[Shi1 zi3], Virgo 室女[Shi4 nu:3], Libra 天秤[Tian1 cheng4], Scorpio 天蠍|天蝎[Tian1 xie1], Sagittarius 人馬|人马[Ren2 ma3], Capricorn 摩羯[Mo2 jie2], Aquarius 寶瓶|宝瓶[Bao3 ping2], Pisces 雙魚|双鱼[Shuang1 yu2]
(TCM) the three truncal cavities (thoracic, abdominal and pelvic), known as the "triple heater" or "San Jiao"
bad luck/unlucky fate
the hidden and the visible/that which can be seen and that which cannot/darkness and light/night and day/wisdom and ignorance/evil and good/the living and the dead/men and ghosts
lightning (archaic word)
Taixu (famed Buddhist monk, 1890-1947)
great emptiness/the void/heaven/the skies/universe/cosmos/original essence of the cosmos
